blocks: Think of your root directory as an Object.
headers: Think of any sub directory or file as key, and it"s contents as the value.
How would you properly organize these Objects?
I usually like to separate things by concern.

content.title: app
children: Conains all Angular js script files.
Conains all html templates used by Angular js
Also contains all css files, that are for each specific html file

content.title: bower_components
children: Contains all downloaded bower files, and all dependencies for the angular app

content.title: styles
children: Any primary styles that overwrite all styles

content.title: .bowerrc
children: This file tells bower where to place the install dependencies.
For example: if you don't like using the word bower_components then change the name in .bowerrc.

content.title: bower.json
children: Contains all Bower Components Configuration.
You can find more about bower at bowerjs.com

content.title: index.html
children: Primary index view.
This is the html template that shows the single page application

blocks: Let's dive into the angluar app.
headers: Do NOT USE the angular-seed!! It is a terrible start for a scalable app.
This structure is the bare bones of a very scalable application.

content.title: Angular Best Practices
children: If you don't understand the strange syntax I am using, we will discuss the angular style guide later.

content.title: app.js
children: This is a root angular module.
The name of this module is the same as the ng-app='app' in the index.html.
Also contains a config component that tells the rout to go to '/' if it cannot find the requested url.

content.title: controllers/
children: Contains all global controllers.
Currenlty contains the controller for the sidebar.

content.title: services/
children: Contains all globally used services.
Currently contains a service to fetch content from build.json.

content.title: states/
children: Contains all states and nested states for the app.
Each state contains it's own html view, it's own controller, and it's own stateProvider.

content.title: templates/
children: Contains all globally used templates, like the sidebar, header, and footer.

blocks: Time to think about scalling this out!
headers: To scale, we are going to need a few things.

content.title: Node.js
children: Google's V8 engine.
Our app is pointless without the power of node.
Provides us with a server, data management, deployment, debugging, testing, automating tasks, and so much more.
